snippet: The founder of  corporate-governance organizations may have a courtly style, but he is hard-charging in his efforts to make companies more transparent and democratic.
abstract: Robert A G Monks, founder of corporate-governance organizations, may have a courtly style, but he is hard-charging in his efforts to make companies more transparent and democratic; he is urging the direct involvement of millions of individual corporate shareholders in mutual funds.
lead_paragraph: The founder of  corporate-governance organizations may have a courtly style, but he is hard-charging in his efforts to make companies more transparent and democratic.

headline.main: Robert A.G. Monks, Crusading Against Corporate Excess
headline.print_headline: Courtly, Yes, but Crusading Against Corporate Excess
